lenders.name: Shane
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference to individual lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I record and sell audio books - recordings of the greatest stories ever written

lenders.name: Gregory
lenders.loan_because: I want those with visions to be able to see them through. I believe in opportunities for everyone. I like the idea of lending without interest. I want to believe in Karma. I wish someone will be kind to me when I am in need. I want to believe in a greater good.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a custodian in a high school. When I can afford it, I would like to work in the film industry, making documentaries or video art.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: My aunt gives me kiva gift cards as christmas presents :D
lenders.occupational_info: I learn in school so i can go to college next year.

lenders.name: Kirk
lenders.loan_because: to spread the blessings God has given me!

lenders.name: Richard
lenders.loan_because:
WalletShop.com.au is an Australian online retailer of men's wallets and accessories including laptop and mobile phone protection. 
We have a strong belief in giving back to the world and helping out entrepreneurs across the world where access to funds and credit is much harder to come by.

lenders.name: Susan Farrar
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others help themselves. I loan because I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with high school age children. My goal is to help them want to be life long learners.

lenders.name: Elisa
lenders.loan_because:
I want to see others succeed in their lives. It's more than just lending money, it's helping someone fulfill their dreams of a better life, and encouraging the entrepreneurial spirit. 


In my photo I included my mom who came to the United States as a young girl. She married and had seven children of her own. It was not always easy for her yet she always gave with an open heart. 

I realize now that no gift is too small to someone in need.

My lending through Kiva is in tribute to my mom.
lenders.occupational_info:
I work as a Realtor in Oakland California. On my website, I use the slogan-Opening the door to Opportunity 

 I like to use the slogan for my business because I feel like I am walking people through the steps of home ownership and if done properly, owning real estate can provide opportunity for people ultimately giving them the chance of a better life.

lenders.name: Josh
lenders.loan_because: Teaching someone to fish is much more worthwhile for everyone than giving someone money to buy a fish
lenders.occupational_info: I build computer software for the Internet

lenders.name: Masao
lenders.loan_because:
I watched KIVA on TV before, and then I've been interested in this system.
Just an individual can be a sponsor.
It's amazing!

lenders.name: Stoian Adrian
lenders.loan_because: I am more than happy to share a percent of my earnings for loans and help people all over the world
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a web designer but i do various types of tasks depends on the project

lenders.name: Jennie
lenders.loan_because: it makes me feel good to help out women in other countries who are creating a better life for themselves and their families.  I feel like I am doing a small part to help make the world a better place to live.
lenders.occupational_info: I perform on the stage, on TV, in films, and on the web, mostly in comedies.  I also sing and dance so I perform in musicals for the stage.  I am a writer as well, and have won awards for my poetry and essays.

lenders.name: bab.la GmbH
lenders.loan_because: Help people help themselves.

lenders.name: Lucinda
lenders.occupation: Athletic Trainer for High School Football Team

lenders.name: Sherryl
lenders.loan_because: This brings money directly to the people that need it. It helps people AND allows them to keep their self-respect because it is a loan not charity. When I was a PCV in India I learned 2 things. One, the money that governments send to other government rarely makes it down to the people that really need it. And two, you don't win friends with foreign aid. It makes the acceptor feel dependent and that grows into resentment. This program bypasses those problems.

lenders.name: Bonnie
lenders.loan_because: To help those in need become more productive.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people buy a home or sell their current home.  I have been in this business for over 30 years.

lenders.name: bp
lenders.loan_because: Everybody wins.  I feel good, Kiva succeeds, and the entrepreneurs get an opportunity to help themselves and their community. Even though the loans are backfill and high interest, its still a net gain (I hope!)
lenders.occupational_info: I make things work better.

lenders.loan_because: I can!

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I believe micro-loans through Kiva.org are an incredible mechanism to help people build their business. It will make the world a better place to live for everyone, one micro-loan at a time.

lenders.name: hyttfors
lenders.loan_because: I can change the world
lenders.occupational_info: Speaking Writing Investing - For the better future

lenders.name: Kiva Jar Donations
lenders.loan_because: I had an idea to raise money to fund Kiva entrepeneurs a number of years ago.  I asked my parents if I could put a fundraising jar on the desk of their shop.  Everyday people coming to the shop made donations into the jar, and this money is now used to fund Kiva entrepreneurs.  Thank you to the wonderful people in Malanda who donated so generously!  Liz

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: It just makes sense. I briefly lived in rural Bangladesh about 25 years ago and saw the benefits of  microlending firsthand.
lenders.occupational_info: I renovate kitchens and bathrooms in old homes in the downtown core of Toronto, Ontario, Canada

lenders.loan_because: This is an exciting way to help people across this small globe of ours.

lenders.name: Melissa

lenders.occupational_info: I am a student, mom, and wife.
